text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with baked lemon pepper salmon
that's right this recipe has it all it's
easy healthy and it looks like you
dropped it in the dirt so I wasn't
completely thrilled with the appearance
and while we're at it I wasn't even that
thrilled with the taste but I still want
you to check out this video because I'm
gonna show you the technique behind
baking salmon properly so I started out
by grinding a whole bunch of black
pepper into some lemon juice and of
course while I was doing this I realized
that watching black pepper be ground
into lemon juice is not that exciting so
I thought maybe I'll change camera
angles a few times but that didn't work
it was still very boring in fact the
only thing I can think of that's more
tedious would be listening to someone
describe how boring grinding black
pepper into lemon juices that would be
brutal but anyway I also decide to add a
spoon of golden me so that is a
fermented soybean paste I threw in a
spoon of Dijon a slightly bigger spoon
of mayonnaise and of course a little
dusting of cayenne and we're just gonna
whisk that up and I really shouldn't use
the freakishly small metal whisk for
this so please pardon the bad whisk to
glass mixing bowl size ratio but it
worked so I mix that up and while I'm
mixing this up let me explain something
this is kind of two videos one is for
the recipe I'm doing here with this
lemon black pepper glaze which was not
as successful as I wanted it to be I'll
explain more about that later and then
the other part of this is just for you
to simply watch how to bake salmon so on
that level the video succeeded but I
don't want you to necessarily feel you
have to make this exact mixture so once
my lemon pepper mixture was done I
proceeded to spread it over two fairly
large wild salmon fillets those were
frozen and thawed and of course I've
said this before frozen wild salmon
better than fresh farmed salmon any day
of the week and I'm not using all of it
I'm gonna save some for later because I
want to put some more on before we bake
it so what I wanted to do here was
spread this very acidic very peppery
marinade over the salmon okay what I was
going for was a partial pre big pickling
of the protein and really if I'm being
honest the alliteration was better than
the idea but you gotta try things so I
spread it all over I wrapped it up I put
in the fridge for 30 minutes after which
I pulled it out transferred it onto a
lined baking sheet to prepare it for the
oven
we're gonna take that little bit of the
lemon a pepper mixture we saved and go
ahead and spread that on top I don't
want to sit in a big pool of that stuff
but I tried to get as much on there as I
could without it running off after that
I decided to grind a little more black
pepper on which of course gave it its
ultimate hey who dropped the salmon in
the campfire look then last but not
least a generous sprinkling of sea salt
or any salt the major difference between
proteins you eat in a restaurant and
proteins you eat at home is the amount
of salt that's applied before it's
cooked true story and after that salmon
was properly seasoned we're gonna pop it
into a very well preheated 450 degree
oven it has to be a very hot oven and
it's gonna cook approximately 10 to 15
minutes or until perfect and how do you
know you have to check with a fork
there's nothing wrong with this
especially on salmon you're gonna have a
natural seam right in the center just
stick your fork in there and look inside
to see if it's to that perfect point
where the salmon is cooked to just
barely medium and you're gonna see that
in a second when we do the final shot of
digging in so do not be afraid to check
no one's gonna notice that when you put
it on the plate
I guess that's one of the advantage of
having such a distracting appearance all
right those little fork marks gonna be
the least of people's worries when you
put this in front of them so you can see
here this is what mine looked like after
about 12 minutes just absolutely
perfectly cooked will flake apart yet
that meat still has a little bit of
opaqueness to it but it is cooked and
hot all the way through so that's
personal preference that's how I think
you should enjoy salmon if you want to
cook it for another three or four
minutes until it's cooked all the way
through go ahead it just won't be as
moist but suit yourself
you are the Commish of your fish and as
far as flavor went this needed some
sweetness the next time I try this I'm
gonna add something like I don't know
maybe a little honey maybe a spoon of
barbecue sauce maybe a little hoisin I
don't know something sweet figuring that
out is a joy that people that don't cook
will never feel it's kind of sad so I'm
not sure if you should try this exact
recipe as shown I really think baking
salmon is a great technique and quick
tip if you're stuck for ideas any
prepared salad dressing usually works
perfect for this procedure so I really
do hope you give it a try
head over to food wishes com for all the
ingredient amounts and more info
usual and as always enjoy
[Music]
